name: Flotilla
description: Lead your orbital battleships to victory in Flotilla! Fight, trade, and explore new planets in your journey through the galaxy. Featuring tactically rich 3D combat, flank and surprise the enemy from any direction. And when the dust settles, generate another uniquely randomized universe for a brand-spanking new adventure!
minimum_requirements: Operating system:   Windows XP or newer Processor:   1GHz Memory:   1GB Hard disk space:   50MB Video:   OpenGL 3.0 or above

reviews.review_text: Lovely little game. If you are looking for tens of hours of gameplay, look somewhere else. But if you want a lovely looking game that you play for 20 mins at a time then this is perfect.

Quite an interesting game. At a quick glance it might just seem an FTL-like space 'roguelike' (well, technically it came out way before FTL), but once you get into it is impossible not to notice a really distinct style and tone that make the game unique.   Flotilla pairs its rts and roguelike mechanics with a weird mixture of surreal humor and melancholic themes (we actually play as a terminal ill character) topping it all off with a beautiful yet simple art style.  Less avant-garde than Gravity Bone (Brandon Chung's previous game) but equally as smart in its execution.   7/10

Have you ever wanted to encounter a band of space owl pirates? This game has them and much more. With an excellent sense of humor and a well-paced space combat element, this game is well worth ten bucks.
This game is great. Slow paced action and great music. It needs an endless mode though.

From the start it was just a poorly made game that was clearly rushed. I came across quite a few game breaking bugs and the graphics are extremely choppy. The mechanics are nice and such but unless this game goes on sale it's not worth the buy.
Fanciful little game with a solid combat system. Worth what you pay for it.

Awesome music and environments. Storyline is pretty bad-♥♥♥ too. It took me a quick minute, but once I became familiar with the mechanics, I gotta say this is a really awesome game. I have come to really love all Blendo games, and this is no exception.

If Homeworld were a roguelike...and had rastafarian cats. Investigate haunted derelicts, gamble away your fortune, help hitchhikers and, inevitably, take on a space deer battleship with your last destroyer and hope you get a lucky hit off before the incoming torpedo fire hits your weak spot.  You're going to die, but will it be your terminal illness or by laser beam frigates piloted by owls jealous of your karaoke abilities?
A fun little 3D turn based space stragety game, great and simple minimalist look accompanied by a very chill mood and fun characters. 8/10

This is an amazing game. Slow paced, tactical space battles with relaxing music and some basic yet still entertaining binary decisions as you reach each planet, which will sometimes end up effecting your battles with rewards and punishments based on your decisions, or starting fights with ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ deer. The game has a Rastafarian Cat group, so what's NOT to like? Well, I'll tell what's not to like. Lasers. They're OP as ♥♥♥♥ and a laser vs laser fight is nothing but luck. The game would be better without lasers. Also the campaigns are FAR too short, you don't get nearly enough time for anything to actually happen. Overall, fantastic game.

A fun strategy game, but very short - the premise is that you're dying of a terminal disease and decide to go on an adventure, but you only get a handful of turns before you kick the bucket. So far I haven't found a real plot or a way to extend the game, but to be fair I haven't played it much.

One of the few space strategy games that actually operates in three dimensions. This game is designed for replayability and has short, randomly generated encounters. If you want homeworld-like strategy challenges in an FTL-sized package, look no further.

In truth - one of the most original and enjoyable games I've had the pleasure of playing in recent memory; easy to learn, difficult to master, and one hell of a wild ride to your inevitable demise each time you play it.
Great strategic space game in the vein of homeworld, but on a smaller scale.
Genial!  Like Weired Worlds. Very Interesting :)

Ecounter weird space aliens and get into tense space battles with some of them while orchestral music plays in the background. If this sounds boring to you, then you have horrible taste. Also, Flotilla is a great game.
Flotilla is entertaining, humerous, short and impossibly tough. That or I'm just terrible at it.
VERY charming game. At first I wasn't feeling this, but after you 'get it', it's an amazing turn based quick fix of delightfull humor and tactics.
